attributes.description: Defines the aviation-grade fuel type compatible with modern turbine engines, ensuring optimal combustion and efficiency.
attributes.name: fuelType

attributes.description: Specifies the maximum storage capacity of the fuel tank, ensuring extended flight operations under peak load conditions.
attributes.name: tankCapacity

attributes.description: Indicates the acceptable operating temperature range for fuel to maintain consistency and prevent degradation.
attributes.name: fuelTemperatureRange

attributes.description: Defines the optimized fuel pump operating pressure range to deliver consistent fuel flow during rapid throttle variations.
attributes.name: pumpPressureRange

attributes.description: Specifies the system redundancy level to ensure continuous operation through triple backup circuits in critical components.
attributes.name: redundancyLevel

attributes.description: Indicates the efficiency of fuel filtration required to maintain engine integrity and performance.
attributes.name: filterEffectiveness

designScenario.description: The Fuel System is a critical subsystem in passenger airplanes, designed to safely store, regulate, and distribute aviation fuel to power the engines. It is engineered to operate efficiently under varying flight conditions, including fluctuations in altitude, pressure, and temperature. Featuring advanced sensor integration and adaptive control mechanisms, the system guarantees optimal fuel delivery and rapid response to engine demands, while incorporating multiple layers of safety and redundancy to ensure compliance with the highest aviation standards.
designScenario.name: Fuel System

details.description: The system shall dynamically adjust fuel flow in real-time using sensor feedback to match the varying demands of engine operation during different flight phases.
The fuel pump must operate within a pressure range of 4-6 Bar and deliver fuel with minimal delay, ensuring engine responsiveness, even under rapid throttle demands.
Implement integrated safety mechanisms, including leak detection sensors, overpressure shutoff valves, and isolated circuit designs to mitigate risks of fuel spills and fire hazards.
The design shall emphasize modularity for ease of maintenance, providing clear diagnostic interfaces and ensuring a mean time between failures of at least 5000 flight hours.

relationships.description: The Fuel Pump Assembly relies on the Fuel Storage Tank for a continuous supply of fuel; any compromise in storage directly affects pump performance.
The Fuel Control Unit is associated with the Fuel Pump Assembly to regulate and modulate fuel flow in response to sensor inputs.
The Fuel Distribution Network is composed within the Fuel Control Unit to ensure precise routing of fuel through manual and automatic control valves.
The Sensor Array aggregates critical data from the Fuel Storage Tank to monitor fuel levels and temperature in real-time.
The Sensor Array also gathers operational data from the Fuel Pump Assembly, enhancing predictive maintenance and adaptive control.

systemComponents.description: A robust storage module engineered to safely house aviation fuel, with reinforced structure and integrated sensor monitoring for fuel level and temperature.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Storage Tank

subComponents.description: Reinforced tank wall designed to withstand high pressures and prevent structural deformation.
subComponents.name: Reinforced Tank Wall

subComponents.description: Internal insulation layer that maintains fuel temperature stability and prevents thermal losses.
subComponents.name: Internal Insulation

subComponents.description: Sensor module incorporating multiple sensors to continuously monitor fuel level and temperature.
subComponents.name: Tank Sensor Module

systemComponents.description: An advanced pump assembly designed to deliver fuel consistently under varying operating conditions with minimal latency.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Pump Assembly

subComponents.description: High-performance fuel pump optimized for rapid fuel delivery and precise control under dynamic conditions.
subComponents.name: High-Performance Pump

subComponents.description: Flow sensor integrated to monitor and regulate the fuel flow rate, ensuring alignment with engine demands.
subComponents.name: Flow Sensor

systemComponents.description: The central electronic module responsible for processing sensor data, managing fuel flow, and coordinating safety protocols.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Control Unit

subComponents.description: A central microcontroller that processes real-time sensor data and executes fuel flow algorithms.
subComponents.name: Central Microcontroller

subComponents.description: Diagnostic interface allowing ground crews and onboard systems to perform maintenance checks and system diagnostics.
subComponents.name: Diagnostic Interface

systemComponents.description: A dedicated filtration module that removes impurities from the fuel to prevent engine damage and ensure optimal combustion.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Filtration Module

subComponents.description: Primary filter designed for high throughput and effective removal of large particulates.
subComponents.name: Primary Filter

subComponents.description: Secondary filter providing additional purification to achieve near-total particulate elimination.
subComponents.name: Secondary Filter

systemComponents.description: A network of distribution components that manage the routing of fuel to various engine sectors through both manual and automated controls.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Distribution Network

subComponents.description: Manual override valve enabling pilot intervention during emergency operations for immediate shutdown or rerouting of fuel.
subComponents.name: Manual Override Valve

subComponents.description: Automatic control valve that receives commands from the Fuel Control Unit for precision fuel distribution.
subComponents.name: Automatic Control Valve

systemComponents.description: An integrated sensor array that provides comprehensive monitoring of fuel system parameters to support adaptive control and predictive maintenance.
systemComponents.name: Sensor Array

subComponents.description: Pressure sensor providing real-time data on fuel line pressure to assist in safe pump operation.
subComponents.name: Pressure Sensor

subComponents.description: Temperature sensor continuously monitoring fuel temperature to ensure fuel quality and system safety.
subComponents.name: Temperature Sensor

subComponents.description: Flow rate sensor that monitors fuel delivery speed for precise calibration of pump performance.
subComponents.name: Flow Rate Sensor

compositions.name: Fuel Delivery System includes Fuel Pump
Fuel Delivery System includes Fuel Control Unit
Fuel Delivery System includes Safety Subsystem

constraints.name: Fuel Pressure Constraint
constraints.specification: Fuel pump pressure must be maintained between 3 and 5 Bar.

constraints.name: Fuel Flow Rate Constraint
constraints.specification: Fuel flow rate must support rapid engine response during emergency maneuvers.

requirements.name: Fuel Delivery Performance Requirement
requirements.text: The fuel pump must deliver fuel at a pressure between 3-5 Bar with a flow rate sufficient to support rapid engine response in emergency maneuvers.

requirements.name: Fuel Safety Requirement
requirements.text: The system shall include overpressure shutoff, leak detection sensors, and isolation valves to prevent fuel spills and fire hazards.

rag_context: The Fuel Delivery System is designed to precisely regulate and distribute fuel to critical aerodynamic surfaces. It ensures optimal fuel flow, monitoring, and safety even under dynamically varying altitude, pressure, and temperature conditions. The system must precisely control the fuel flow rate and pressure to meet the varying demands during different phases of flight including takeoff, cruise, and landing. The fuel pump must deliver fuel at a pressure range between 3-5 Bar with a flow rate that supports rapid engine response in emergency maneuvers. Safety mechanisms such as overpressure shutoff, leak detection sensors, and isolation valves are included to prevent fuel spills and fire hazards. The system is designed for high reliability, ease of maintenance, and long service intervals, with a failure rate that meets or exceeds aviation industry standards.
